intro: Thlaspi alpestre var. purpurascens, commonly known as the alpine rockcress, is a flowering plant native to mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun. Its leaves are basal, pinnately divided, and often covered in a waxy coating to reduce water loss. The flowers are usually yellow or white, with four petals, and the plant is known for its ability to tolerate cold and harsh climatic conditions.
